AUTHOR: St. Ber-nard (1091-1153). METER: Iambic dimeter. TRANSLATION by Cardinal Newman. There are eight translations. LITURGICAL Usa: Hymn for Lauds on the Feast of the Transfiguration of Our Lord. This hymn is a cento from St. Bernard's Jesu dulcis memoria. First line of Original Text: Amor J esu dulcissime.

Thou com- peer at the right hand of the Father, Thou sweet light of heaven, imperceptible to the senses of the flesh.'’ The things denied to fleshly sense are hinted at by St. Paul, who was taken up to the third heaven: Quod oculus non vidit, nec auris audivit, nec in cor hominis ascendit, quae praeparavit Deus iis, qui diligunt illum (I Cor. 2, 9).
